title: Entity Extraction from Documents
description:
Entity Extraction from Documents Using Gemini LLM

Implement automated entity extraction from document uploads using Google's Gemini language model.

Technical Implementation:
- LLM Integration: Google Gemini API (gemini-pro or gemini-1.5-flash model)
- Document Processing: Support PDF, DOCX, TXT formats using libraries (PyPDF2/pdfplumber, python-docx)
- API Endpoints: 
  - POST /api/documents/upload (multipart/form-data)
  - POST /api/documents/:id/extract (trigger extraction)
  - GET /api/documents/:id/entities (retrieve results)
- Data Models:
  - Document (id, filename, upload_date, status, file_path)
  - Entity (id, document_id, type, value, confidence, position)
  - EntityType enum (PERSON, ORGANIZATION, LOCATION, DATE, MONEY, etc.)

Processing Pipeline:
1. File upload â†’ storage (S3/local filesystem)
2. Text extraction from document
3. Chunking for large documents (handle Gemini token limits ~30k)
4. Prompt engineering: structured output format (JSON schema)
5. Entity extraction via Gemini API with retry logic
6. Post-processing: deduplication, confidence filtering
7. Store entities in database with references to source document

Components:
- DocumentUploader (drag-drop with file type validation)
- ExtractionStatus (progress indicator, job queue status)
- EntityTable (filterable by type, sortable by confidence)
- EntityHighlighter (visualize entities in original document)

Infrastructure:
- Background job queue (Celery/Bull) for async processing
- Rate limiting for Gemini API calls (respect quota)
- Webhook/WebSocket for real-time status updates

Error Handling:
- Unsupported file formats
- Gemini API failures (retry with exponential backoff)
- Token limit exceeded (automatic chunking strategy)
- Low confidence results (configurable threshold)

Security:
- File upload size limits (10MB default)
- Virus scanning on uploaded documents
- Access control: users can only access their own documents
- Sanitize extracted entities before storage (prevent injection)

Performance Considerations:
- Cache extraction results
- Batch processing for multiple documents
- Stream large document processing
- Index entities for fast searching
